metadata.title: CVE-2013-2480 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The RTPS and RTPS2 dissectors in Wireshark 1.6.x before 1.6.14 and 1.8.xbefore 1.8.6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) via a malformed packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
